title: EU-LAC Dialogue on Artificial Intelligence: Opportunities and Governance for Sustainable Development
executive_summary: On March 13, 2024, the EU-LAC Digital Alliance convened in Montevideo, Uruguay, to explore the transformative potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI) for socio-economic growth in Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC). The dialogue, featuring representatives from the EU and LAC countries, focused on governance, regulatory convergence, and the sustainable development applications of AI. Keynote speeches highlighted the EU AI Act's vision for human-centric AI and the importance of global collaboration. The event emphasized multi-stakeholder participation, including civil society and academia, and will be followed by training initiatives to empower policymakers. This dialogue is part of ongoing efforts leading to the IX Ministerial Conference on the Information Society (eLAC 2024) in Chile, reinforcing the commitment to shared values and collaborative strategies in AI development.
characteristics: The EU-LAC Digital Alliance held a Policy Dialogue on AI in Montevideo on March 13, 2024, focusing on risks and opportunities for socio-economic growth.
Key topics included governance, regulatory convergence, training, and AI applications for sustainable development.
The dialogue emphasized a multi-stakeholder approach, involving civil society, academia, and the private sector.
The EU AI Act was presented as a framework for promoting human-centric and trustworthy AI.
Future training for policymakers will support the implementation of AI ethics, backed by a €4 million project with UNESCO.
practical_applications: The EU-LAC Digital Alliance held a Policy Dialogue on Artificial Intelligence on 13 March 2024, focusing on governance, regulatory convergence, standards, training, capacity building, and AI applications for sustainable development.
The European Commission and UNESCO are collaborating on a €4 million project to support the implementation of UNESCO’s Recommendation on the Ethics of AI.
The initiative on AI is being led by Chile, Brazil, Uruguay, Spain, Slovenia, and the European Commission, building on previous work from the EU-LAC Digital Alliance conference in November 2023.
commitments: The European Commission and UNESCO will work together on a €4 million project to support partners in the implementation of UNESCO’s Recommendation on the Ethics of AI.
The IX Ministerial Conference on the Information Society (eLAC 2024) will be held in Chile in November 2024.

issues: Potential factual errors in basic content or strategic extra data

commitment_details.text: The European Commission and UNESCO will work together on a €4 million project to support partners in the implementation of UNESCO’s Recommendation on the Ethics of AI.
The IX Ministerial Conference on the Information Society (eLAC 2024) will be held in Chile in November 2024.

kpi_list.kpi_text: The European Commission and UNESCO will work together on a €4 million project to support partners in the implementation of UNESCO’s Recommendation on the Ethics of AI.
kpi_list.target_description: Funding for the implementation of AI ethics recommendations
kpi_list.measurement_method: Project funding allocation and implementation progress

kpi_list.kpi_text: The initiative on AI was led by Chile, Brazil, Uruguay, Spain, Slovenia and the European Commission.
kpi_list.target_description: Leadership and collaboration among participating countries in AI initiatives
kpi_list.measurement_method: Assessment of collaborative efforts and leadership roles

kpi_list.kpi_text: This event takes place in the context of the preparatory meeting for the IX Ministerial Conference on the Information Society (eLAC 2024), coordinated by the United Nations Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean (ECLAC), that will be held in Chile in November.
kpi_list.target_description: Preparation and coordination for the eLAC 2024 conference
kpi_list.measurement_method: Evaluation of preparatory activities and coordination efforts

kpi_list.kpi_text: The programme focused on 3 main topics: governance, regulatory convergence and standards, training and capacity building and the uses of AI for sustainable development.
kpi_list.target_description: Addressing governance, training, and sustainable development in AI
kpi_list.measurement_method: Review of programme outcomes and focus area effectiveness

sdg_alignment: SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth

top_actors.name: European Union
top_actors.justification: The European Union is central to the dialogue on AI, as it is the primary actor organizing the event and promoting the EU AI Act, which outlines the strategic vision for AI development.

top_actors.name: European Commission
top_actors.justification: The European Commission plays a crucial role in presenting the EU AI Act and is involved in key initiatives like the collaboration with UNESCO, highlighting its influence on AI policy.

top_actors.name: EU-LAC Digital Alliance
top_actors.justification: The EU-LAC Digital Alliance is the framework within which the dialogue on AI is taking place, emphasizing its importance in fostering collaboration between the EU and Latin American countries.

top_themes.name: Artificial Intelligence
top_themes.justification: Artificial Intelligence is the central theme of the document, as it discusses its potential, risks, and opportunities for socio-economic growth in the context of the EU-LAC Digital Alliance. The entire dialogue revolves around AI, making it the most important theme.

top_themes.name: EU-LAC Digital Alliance
top_themes.justification: The EU-LAC Digital Alliance serves as the framework for the discussions on AI, highlighting the collaboration between the EU and Latin American and Caribbean countries. It is crucial for understanding the context and objectives of the dialogue.

top_themes.name: Bi-regional Cooperation
top_themes.justification: Bi-regional cooperation is important as it underpins the collaborative efforts between the EU and LAC countries in addressing AI-related challenges. While it is less central than the first two themes, it supports the overarching goals of the dialogue.
